page.title: 13VALLEY PARK
page.content: Valley Park (sometimes called the Linear Park) is a former railway line which has been turned into a footpath from Aldersley to Castlecroft.It then links with the existing footpath along the line to Wombourne.The park closely follows the Staffordshire and Worcestershire Canal. The park is used for nature study,bird watching and dog walking.Some people simply walk while others run for exercise.It is also used by motor cyclists and horse riders,although this is illegal.Some people use Valley Park as a short cut to get to work and many children use it to walk to nearby schools. Near St. Michael's School is the old Tettenhall Station which is currently being renovated.Like some other parts of the park it has suffered from vandalism in recent years.
